titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William B. Frame Reminiscence circa 1937
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by MarcEdit

publicationstmt.publisher: Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana--Missoula

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard)

repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: Reminiscence of fighting a forest fire in the Kootenai Forest in northwestern Montana while working for the Civilian Conservation Corps during the Great Depression.

bioghist.p: William B. "Scotty" Frame was a resident of Butte, Montana. Frame worked in the Civilian Conservation Corps in northwestern Montana. After his time in the CCC, Frame returned to Butte to practice law. He started his own law firm, Frame, Foley, and Holland. Frame died in 1972.

scopecontent.p: Reminiscence of fighting a forest fire in the Kootenai Forest in northwestern Montana while working for the Civilian Conservation Corps during the Great Depression.
